x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
By creating a centralized, digital platform for mentorship, learning opportunities, and career preparation, SkillBridge can:

  • Connect students with verified mentors from various industries.
  • Help youth find local or virtual workshops, internships, and events.
  • Let educators and NGOs track youth engagement and progress.
  • Close the gap between education and employability.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Many young people, especially in under-resourced communities, lack access to mentorship, skill-building opportunities, and career guidance. They might not know what career paths exist, how to prepare for them, or how to access training and internships.
Schools and local organisations often run mentorship or training programs — but coordination is scattered, and students miss out due to lack of awareness or poor engagement.
Example use case -
A 17-year-old student logs into SkillBridge and selects an interest in IT careers.The app recommends mentors, upcoming coding workshops, and beginner course materials.The student books a mentorship session.The mentor receives a task notification in ServiceNow and conducts a virtual session.After the session, both leave feedback, and the platform updates the student’s progress.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Capability

Purpose

App Engine Studio

To build the no-code/low-code application

Service Catalog

For students to request mentorship or sign up for programs

Flow Designer

Automate mentor matching, session reminders, and follow-ups

Notification Engine

Alerts for upcoming sessions, new opportunities

Record Producers

For submitting mentorship interests or feedback

Dashboards / PA

Visualize engagement rates, number of sessions, mentor participation

ServiceNow Mobile App

Allow students and mentors to interact on-the-go

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with external video platforms (Zoom, Google Meet) for virtual sessions.
  • Optional integration with LinkedIn APIs or similar for mentor verification.
  • Google Maps or location API (if recommending nearby workshops or training centers).
  • SMS/Email gateway for mobile-first communication.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. User onboarding & verification: Ensuring mentors and students are real and approved.
  2. Data privacy: Protecting personal data, especially for minors.
  3. Engagement: Getting consistent participation from both students and mentors.
  4. Scaling: As the number of users grows, ensuring performance and usability.
  5. Accessibility: Designing for mobile and low-bandwidth environments.
  6. Program governance: Different schools or NGOs may want custom workflows or reporting.
